required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic VEnous dIsorders maNagement and Treatment effectivenesS evaluaTion in Chronic vEnous Disease, an International Program
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Observational (Non-interventional), International Study to Assess Effectiveness of Conservative Treatments in Chronic Venous Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to assess in real-life settings the effectiveness of conservative treatments on symptoms, signs and quality of life, in patients consulting for CVD

primary_outcome.description: Measured by visual analogue scale (VAS) and questioning with 4 points rate
Measured by Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) scale, and time to improvement.
Measured by VCSS (Venous Clinical Severity score)

study_pop.textblock: Male and female patients consulting spontaneously or referred for symptomatic CVD not requiring surgical treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 years old
- Patient consulting spontaneously or referred for symptomatic venous disorders
- Diagnosis of chronic venous disease according to investigator's judgment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of known severe systemic disease likely to interfere with the study evaluation
- Patients with lower limb arterial disease
- Patient with any other concomitant disease or treatment that may interfere with lower limb pain or edema
- Patient consulting for an emergency not related to venous disease
- Patient currently taking any treatment for chronic venous disorders, either with venoactive drug or with compression hosiery
- Procedure or surgery for venous disease planned during the study
- Pregnant or breastfeeding woman
